intro: Tristachya scaettae, commonly known as the Scaetta's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands and marshy areas of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, grasses, and rushes. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that bloom in late summer. Tristachya scaettae typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to aquatic environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
